crops.title: Major Crops of Sri Lanka
crops.subtitle: Information about key crops grown across different regions.

rice.name: Rice (Paddy)
rice.description: The staple food crop of Sri Lanka, grown in both Maha and Yala seasons. Suitable for various regions with proper irrigation. Traditional and improved varieties are available with different growth durations.

varieties.name: Tomato
varieties.description: Varieties like Thilina and Maheshi are widely grown. Prefers well-drained soils with pH 6.0-7.0.

varieties.name: Onions
varieties.description: Big onion varieties (Hybrid 62, Bhima Shakti) and Red onion varieties (Vethalan, LKRON 1) are important cash crops.

varieties.name: Potato
varieties.description: Varieties like Granola and Desiree grow well in up-country regions during Maha season.

varieties.name: Carrot
varieties.description: New Kuroda and Chantenay varieties are popular in cooler regions with loose, deep soils.

varieties.name: Maize
varieties.description: Varieties like Pacific 984 and Arjun are important for both human consumption and animal feed.

varieties.name: Green Gram
varieties.description: Short duration crop suitable for areas with less rainfall.

varieties.name: Cowpea
varieties.description: Drought-tolerant crop suitable for dry and intermediate zones.

varieties.name: Groundnut
varieties.description: Grown mainly in the dry zone during both Maha and Yala seasons.

varieties.name: Tea
varieties.description: Grown in high, mid, and low elevations with different quality characteristics.

varieties.name: Rubber
varieties.description: Mainly in wet and intermediate zones.

varieties.name: Coconut
varieties.description: Grown in the "Coconut Triangle" and other suitable areas.

soil.title: Soil Types in Sri Lanka
soil.subtitle: Major soil types found across the country and their characteristics.

types.name: Red Yellow Podzolic
types.description: Common in the wet zone, this soil is well-drained but acidic. Good for tea cultivation and some vegetables with proper management.

types.name: Reddish Brown Earth
types.description: Found in the dry zone, suitable for many field crops. Has good fertility when adequate water is available.

types.name: Low Humic Gley
types.description: Common in lowland paddy fields, has poor drainage but good water-holding capacity. Ideal for rice cultivation.

types.name: Alluvial Soils
types.description: Found along river valleys and flood plains, these soils are highly fertile and suitable for intensive cultivation of vegetables and other crops.
